Comments_List: About 10-20 depending on the week
10 hours
amazing experience.
AP- experience can be variable depending on preceptor.

This course was absolutely amazing! With my placement in the CT General Assembly, I learned so much about state legislature and Connecticut's specific process for lawmaking. Although it was slow sometimes (partially since my senator was new), this experience still taught me a lot and showed me how much thought goes into each bill but also how bureaucratic it is. This experience definitely made me appreciate the CT state legislators even more since they do so much but they are only part-time. Overall, great experience!
Amazing. Shelley is such a great mentor

First hands on/applied experience at YSPH. Incredibly meaningful and worthwhile
this course needs more admin support though - especially re transportation and other logistics

The Health Policy practicum was the highlight of my time at YSPH. It allowed me to generate work experience in exactly the field I want to work in after graduation. My work in the practicum has helped me immensely in interviews and cover letters in my job search. YSPH, please support this course in every way you can.
Uttermost necessary course as a health policy student. It should be a requirement for the program.
I thought my practicum experience was excellent, and I enjoyed hearing about everyone else's experience as well.
Amazing experience.
Great course-very exciting time to take the practicum and be involved with policy work in CT.
Best professor at Yale.
Prof. Geballe is so supportive, caring and will do anything to help the practicum work well. So grateful to have her as our Professor

LOVE SHELLEY!! She is so supportive and was always ready to provide support/be a guiding light when needed! I think that Shelley is one of my favorite parts of the practicum because she's very helpful and there's honestly nothing that she needs to improve on.
Amazing
Continuously the most caring professor in the department. Goes above and too beyond to provide the best learning experience for each student in each placement. I am stunned.

Shelley Geballe is the best part of the School of Public Health. She believes fiercely in her students and is always there to meet to troubleshoot issues. She has high standards for our quality of work because she believes we can meet them, and I produce better quality work because of her. I am so humbled that she quite literally puts her reputation on the line (and YSPH in general) reaching out to organizations to request placements for us. Because of Shelley, I got to work with my dream organization and gain invaluable work experience. Thank you, Shelley!
Amazing as always.
One of the best professors at YSPH. Creates an environment for students to learn, succeed, and do good in the world. Always helpful and caring.
She is a wonderful educator and person.
Very helpful and responsive. Truly cares about her students and their experience's.
Yes-- Great to put learning into practice!

As and AP and practising physician I don't see the practicum component of the course as particularly valuable, but I don't think the Helath Policy practicum would have been any different to any of the others on offer.

To summarize this course, if you want exposure to lawmaking and policy in action, this is a great practicum for that! I would definitely recommend it because although sometimes it was a bit slow, it was a great educational experience!
great way to get real hands on experience - both for students with work experience and students who came straight from undergrad.

Take this course if you have the time to dedicate to it. If you want to take this class on an already overenrolled schedule, drop another demanding course, and take this one instead. You will get what you put into the practicum, and if you put the time into it, it will be extremely rewarding.
Would recommend to others.
Experiences vary depending on your placement, but would definitely recommend.
